result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J. Cowan

records.addlTxt:
10:10 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Thomas J. Cowan, appeared with Attorney Toni L. Young.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Young states the matter is not resolved and requests a trail date. Discussion held regarding dates. The State does not object.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 8, 2023 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant, Thomas J. Cowan, appeared with Attorney Toni L. Young.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Young. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas J. Cowan
Current: 3823 29th Avenue,   Lower, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States  (Effective: 06-14-2022)
Prior: 6910 16th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53143
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 10:15 am.

200PM    Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:15 am. Bond continued posted with same conditions as previously set (see previous bond entry). rb

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

09:17 AM Defendant, Thomas J. Cowan, appeared.  Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Tanya P, JKJ, ERJ.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

01:57 PM  Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on May 3, 2022 at 08:45 am.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
and witness list filed by the State
